poem:
Title: "Golden Muse under the Hammer"

Art priced by the billions; a golden muse sold.
Can Picasso's touch ever truly be bought,
Or is it just the echo of the coin's cold fold?
Blind in excess, a spectacle of wealth sought,
Yet, starved remains the soul's deep, untouched wold. 
Sotheby's, your ledger swells, a gilded rot, 
Where canvas turns to commodity, love to gold.
